projects.title: 1% Everyday
projects.description: Inspired by the Kaizen philosophy of continuously improving, I try to apply the "improve at least 1% everyday" to everything that I'm willing to do. Keeping a steady movement towards goals, even if it seems slow in the short term, in the long term things will be clearer and attainable.

projects.title: Don't Be Afraid To Break Things
projects.description: To make experimentation and innovation possible, build an environment and have tools in place where things can break, and, when it does, you'll be able mitigate the issues or quickly revert the changes to a safe version. For that to happen, automated tests, a version control system, observability and automation are indispensable.

projects.title: No Over-Engineering
projects.description: Although I'm constantly learning new concepts and technologies to understand when and where these could improve what I'm currently working on or will build eventually, I always aim for simplicity when applying my knowledge to building software or designing a user interface. Only add layers of complexity when they provenly will bring value to what you're building.
